Title: Spectrally Resolved Earth Reflectance
Description: Spectrally-resolved Earth Reflectance:  On-orbit SI-traceable spectrally-resolved Earth reflectances referenced to spectral solar irradiance with average uncertainty <= 0.3% (k=1) for the 350 - 2300 nm wavelength range.

Title: Spectrally Resolved Earth Reflectance
Description: Spectrally-resolved Earth Reflectance:  On-orbit SI-traceable spectrally-resolved Earth reflectances referenced to spectral solar irradiance with average uncertainty <= 0.3% (k=1) for the 350 - 2300 nm wavelength range.

Description: Spectrally-resolved Earth Reflectance:  On-orbit SI-traceable spectrally-resolved Earth reflectances referenced to spectral solar irradiance with average uncertainty <= 0.3% (k=1) for the 350 - 2300 nm wavelength range.

Title: Spectrally Resolved Earth Reflectance
Description: Spectrally-resolved Earth Reflectance:  On-orbit SI-traceable spectrally-resolved Earth reflectances referenced to spectral solar irradiance with average uncertainty <= 0.3% (k=1) for the 350 - 2300 nm wavelength range.

Title: Spectrally Integrated Earth Reflectance
Description: Spectrally Integrated Earth Reflectance:  On-orbit SI-traceable broadband (350 - 2300 nm) spectrally-integrated Earth reflectance with uncertainty <= 0.3% (k=1), with spectral accuracy weighted using global average Earth spectrally reflected energy.

Title: Spectrally Integrated Earth Reflectance
Description: Spectrally Integrated Earth Reflectance:  On-orbit SI-traceable broadband (350 - 2300 nm) spectrally-integrated Earth reflectance with uncertainty <= 0.3% (k=1), with spectral accuracy weighted using global average Earth spectrally reflected energy.

Title: On-Orbit Inter-Calibration
Description: On-Orbit Reference Inter-Calibration: Establish an in-orbit transfer standard for intercalibration of the reflectance bands of the VIIRS instrument and the CERES/RBI instrument's shortwave channel.  The inter-calibration uncertainties shall be equal to or less than the spectrometer calibration uncertainties in section 4.1.1 a) and 4.1.1 b).

Title: On-Orbit Inter-Calibration

Title: Project Category
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall be Category 3 per NASA Space Flight Program and Project Management Requirements, NPR 7120.5E, and the mission class shall be D per Risk Classification for NASA Payloads, NPR 8705.4.
Rationale: Programmatic requirement without technical child requirements.

Title: Use of ISS as the Science Platform
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder payload shall utilize the ISS as the science platform.

Title: In-Orbit Commissioning Period
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall complete the In-Orbit Checkout (IOC) period within 60 days after installation on the International Space Station (ISS). Science Operations will begin upon completion of IOC.

Title: Pointing Ability for Calibration
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder pointing system shall be capable of pointing the reflected-solar spectrometer to view the Moon and Sun for calibration.

Title: Pointing Ability for Inter-Calibration
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder pointing system shall be capable of pointing the reflected-solar spectrometer to enable collection of inter-calibration data which are matched in time, space, and viewing angles with measurements made by VIIRS and CERES.

Title: Pointing Ability for Inter-Calibration
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder pointing system shall be capable of pointing the reflected-solar spectrometer to enable collection of inter-calibration data which are matched in time, space, and viewing angles with measurements made by VIIRS and CERES.

Title: Pointing Ability for Inter-Calibration
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder pointing system shall be capable of pointing the reflected-solar spectrometer to enable collection of inter-calibration data which are matched in time, space, and viewing angles with measurements made by VIIRS and CERES.

Title: Pointing Ability for Inter-Calibration
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder pointing system shall be capable of pointing the reflected-solar spectrometer to enable collection of inter-calibration data which are matched in time, space, and viewing angles with measurements made by VIIRS and CERES.

Title: Spectral Sampling
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder reflected-solar spectrometer shall have <= 4-nm spectral sampling and <= 8-nm spectral resolution.

Title: Spectral Response Range
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder reflected-solar spectrometer spectral response range shall be 350 nm to 2300 nm.

Title: CPF Minimum Inter-Calibration Events
Description: CLARREO Pathfinder shall acquire a minimum of 175 inter-calibration events to demonstrate inter-calibration with CERES/VIIRS at the Threshold inter-calibration uncertainty levels specified in Section 4.1.2
Rationale: Threshold requirement. Has no child requirements by design

Title: CPF Science Mission Lifetime - Baseline
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project baseline science mission lifetime is one year following completion of IOC for the installed instrument.

Title: CPF Science Mission Lifetime - Threshold
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project threshold science mission lifetime requirement is 6 months following completion of IOC for the installed instrument.
Rationale: Threshold version of PLRA.10115. Has no child requirements by design.

Title: Decommissioning
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall be capable of completing decommissioning activities within 3 months following the end of the science mission.

Title: Launch Vehicle
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder payload shall be delivered to the ISS via launch services provided by the ISS program.

Title: Launch Readiness Date
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall target a Launch Readiness Date no later than the end of calendar year 2022 (TBC).
Rationale: Programmatic requirement without technical child requirements.

Title: Robotically Installed and Uninstalled
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder payload shall be designed for both robotic installation to, and removal from the ISS Expedite the Processing of Experiments to Space Station (ExPRESS) Logistics Carrier (ELC).

Title: Ground Segment
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall develop and operate a ground system to meet the science requirements in section 4.1 and the data requirements in section 4.5.

Title: Science Data Product Formats
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project science data product formats shall conform to the HDF5 standard.

Title: Science Data Product Formats
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project science data product formats shall conform to the HDF5 standard.

Title: Science Data Products Metadata
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Science data products metadata shall conform to ISO 19115 Geographic Information - Metadata standards and adhere to the Metadata Requirements – Base Reference for NASA Earth Science Data Products document published at http://earthdata.nasa.gov/about-eosdis/requirements, and the CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall baseline to a specific initial version before launch.

Title: Science Data Products Metadata
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Science data products metadata shall conform to ISO 19115 Geographic Information - Metadata standards and adhere to the Metadata Requirements – Base Reference for NASA Earth Science Data Products document published at http://earthdata.nasa.gov/about-eosdis/requirements, and the CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall baseline to a specific initial version before launch.

Title: Full Resolution Browse Products
Description: For all standard data products that can be meaningfully represented as images, CLARREO Pathfinder shall generate full-resolution browse products.

Title: Long Term Knowledge Preservation
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall transfer to the [ESD Identified DAAC] all the information and documentation required for long-term preservation of knowledge about the products resulting from the CLARREO Pathfinder Project, as defined in the NASA Earth Science Data Preservation Content Specification document published at http://earthdata.nasa.gov/about-eosdis/requirements, and shall baseline to a specific initial version.

Title: Long Term Knowledge Preservation
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall transfer to the [ESD Identified DAAC] all the information and documentation required for long-term preservation of knowledge about the products resulting from the CLARREO Pathfinder Project, as defined in the NASA Earth Science Data Preservation Content Specification document published at http://earthdata.nasa.gov/about-eosdis/requirements, and shall baseline to a specific initial version.

Title: Data Products
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall produce the standard science data products listed in Table 1. Standard data products are fully validated against Level 1 requirements.
Rationale: 1 The NASA HQ Archive will be at the TBD.DAAC. 2 Data latency is defined as the elapsed time from the downlink to the availability of processed level 2 data products to the public.

Title: Publicly Available Data Products
Description: The standard science data products listed in Table 1, along with the scientific source code for algorithm software, coefficients, and ancillary data used to generate these products shall be made publicly available.  Public release of these data shall conform to the NASA Earth Science Data and Information Policy (http://science.nasa.gov/earth-science/earth-science-data/data-information-policy/).  There shall be no period of exclusive access.

Title: Science Algorithms
Description: Science algorithms used to generate the standard data products listed in Table 1 shall be documented in Algorithm Theoretical Basis Documents (ATBDs) and be available to the public through the same source as the mission science data.  The ATBD will be maintained through the life of the project.
Rationale: This requirement is met by delivery of SE-9 Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document in the Data Requirements List (DRL) which is attachment 3 to the Statement of Work (SOW).

Title: Data Collection and Archiving
Description: The CLARREO Pathfinder Project shall coordinate with the [ESD Identified DAAC] on the release of product versions, to ensure completeness and accuracy of quality information, validation status, and metadata of the CLARREO Pathfinder science data products.
